idea-plugin.name: CODE Methodology
idea-plugin.description:
CODE – a code base management methodology based on adapting the PDCA cycle to industrial software development processes. The plugin integrates the four stages of the methodology directly into the IntelliJ IDEA / Android Studio workflow: the Prepare stage checks the correctness of the branch and the start of development; the Develop stage ensures compliance with code style rules; the Control stage analyzes test coverage and generates recommendations; the Apply stage evaluates the integration readiness of changes and helps generate Pull Requests.

The methodology forms a manageable quality control cycle, combining formal metrics, requirements for change structure, and intelligent recommendations based on a generative language model.

CODE method diagram:

   ┌────────────┐      ┌─────────────┐      ┌─────────────┐      ┌────────────┐
   │  PREPARE   │──→───│   DEVELOP   │──→───│   CONTROL   │──→───│   APPLY    │
   └─────┬──────┘      └──────┬──────┘      └──────┬──────┘      └─────┬──────┘
         └──────────────←─────┴──────────────←─────┴──────────────←────┘

A detailed description of the methodology is available in the article:
METHODOLOGY FOR MANAGING THE CODE BASE OF SOFTWARE SYSTEMS IN THE DIGITAL ECONOMY
